comment.author: 18901029@N00
comment._content: Probably taken from somewhere around what is now Clyne Reserve above Barangaroo. Goat Island is in the middle distance with Long Nose Point behind it.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/donshearman] Thanks for pointing out those landmarks.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
This is not taken from above Barrangaroo.   It is taken from somewhere on the north side of Observatory Hill.

In fact by triangulating from Balls Head,  it is quite clear that the photo is taken from the tall chimney in George Street north  and the houses in the foreground are in Lower Fort Street.   The wharves are at Walsh Bay -  the old ones before they were rebuilt.    The end of Miller's Point is at the left edge the photo.

The houses in the foreground are still there,   and you can match the irregular pattern of chimneys and attic windows on Google Earth.

comment.author: 48420463@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Thanks for that. Can you give a link to the Google Earth reference?
